metadata.case_name: Mohd. Yunus Saleem v. Shiv Kumar Shastri

facts.text: Election to Lok Sabha from 76 Aligarh Parliamentary constituency in general elections held in March 1971. Constituency consists of five Assembly constituencies: 376-Aligarh, 377-Koil, 378-Iglas, 379-Khair, 380-Chandaus.
Seven candidates contested. Poll scheduled in Aligarh and Koil on March 1, 1971, and in Iglas, Khair, Chandaus on March 3, 1971.
Polling in Aligarh and Koil completed peacefully on March 1, 1971. Appellant Mohd. Yunus Saleem obtained highest votes: Aligarh 44,422, Koil 25,228. Shiv Kumar Shastri: Aligarh 4,719, Koil 16,260.
Vote chart: Pooran Singh Malan (SSP, sponsored by alliance): Aligarh 18,385, Koil 4,165; others lower.
On March 2, 1971, communal riot between Hindus and Muslims in Aligarh city. Election Commission postponed poll in remaining segments from March 3 to March 9, 1971.
On March 9, 1971 poll: Shiv Kumar Shastri obtained high votes: Iglas 42,281, Khair 53,240, Chandaus 43,012; total 180,313. Declared elected.
Appellant filed Election Petition No. 6 of 1971 in Allahabad High Court challenging election on grounds of corrupt practices and questions of law. High Court dismissed on December 21, 1971.
Election Commission notification dated January 27, 1971: nominations by Feb 3, scrutiny Feb 4, withdrawal Feb 6, polls March 1-5, completion by March 15.

Allegation on Issue 5: Meeting on March 6, 1971 at K.N. Agarwal's residence. Offer of Rs.30,000-35,000 and Legislative Council seat to Pooran Singh Malan (Resp No.2) by Shiv Kumar Shastri and others to withdraw. Malan announced withdrawal and asked supporters to vote for Shastri.
Pooran Singh Malan continued contesting and polled votes on March 9: Iglas 310, Khair 337, Chandaus 386; total 23,583.
Issue 7 allegation: On March 7, 1971, Resp No.1 with Hukum Singh threatened Muslim voters in Sapera village to swear by Quran to vote for him, not appellant.

Issues 8,8A,9,10,11: Appeals to Hindu/Jat/Thakur voters against Muslim appellant, false statements about riots, between March 7-9, 1971 in Gordha, Iglas, Khair, Chandaus, etc. by Resp No.1 and agents.

legal_issues.text: Whether the order of the Election Commission adjourning the poll from 3rd March to 9th March was without jurisdiction and illegal? (Issue No. 2)
Whether Pooran Singh Malan withdrew from the election on 6th March and asked supporters to vote for Resp No.1 as result of inducements by Resp No.1? (Issue No. 5)
Whether voters induced by threats by Hukum Singh, polling agent of Resp No.1, to promise to vote for petitioner but vote for Resp No.1? (Issue No. 7)
Whether Resp No.1 and others appealed to Hindu voters not to vote for petitioner because Muslim; similar appeals in Khair, Chandaus, Iglas? (Issue No. 8)
Whether Resp No.1 and others made speeches alleging petitioner responsible for communal riots, known to be false? (Issue No. 8A)
Whether Virendra Varma and Raghunath Singh appealed to Jat voters for Resp No.1 as candidate of Charan Singh's party? (Issue No. 9)
Whether Resp No.1's agent and others appealed to Jat/Thakur voters at Iglas not to vote for Muslim petitioner? (Issue No. 10)
Whether at Iglas meeting, Yogendra Pal Singh falsely stated petitioner was Razakar and instigated riots? (Issue No. 11)
Whether Resp No.1 committed corrupt practices u/s 123(1),(2),(3),(3A),(4)? (Issue No. 12)

petitioner_arguments.text: Election Commission had no jurisdiction to alter poll dates under s.30(d) except u/s 57/58; s.153 inapplicable as completion date March 15 not exceeded.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Representation of the People Act, 1951 ss.30,57,58,153

petitioner_arguments.text: Pooran Singh Malan induced by bribe (Rs.30-35k) and Council seat promise on March 6 to withdraw and direct votes to Resp No.1.
Threats by Hukum Singh to Muslim voters in Sapera to swear by Quran for Resp No.1.
Communal appeals by Resp No.1/agents against Muslim petitioner, false riot blame in various meetings March 7-9.

respondent_arguments.text: Election Commission has power u/s.30 r/w s.21 General Clauses Act to amend poll dates; s.153 also supports.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Representation of the People Act s.30,153; General Clauses Act s.21

respondent_arguments.text: No bribe offered to Malan post-withdrawal date; he continued contesting and polled votes; 'withdraw' in s.123(1)(A)(a) limited to legal withdrawal u/s.37.
All corrupt practice allegations denied; witnesses unreliable, turned hostile or politically motivated.

court_reasoning.text: Election Commission has power u/s.30 r/w s.21 General Clauses Act to amend poll dates; s.153 inapplicable but not needed; within completion date March 15; no fresh Form 1 needed.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Power to notify includes power to amend.

court_reasoning.text: 'Withdraw or not to withdraw from being a candidate' in s.123(1)(A)(a) includes post-legal withdrawal stage to ensure purity of elections; deletion of 'retire from contest' not restrictive.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Wide amplitude to prevent bribe-induced non-contest.

court_reasoning.text: Petitioner's evidence on Malan bribe unreliable: solitary witness PW20 turned party; others improbable, no corroboration; Malan polled votes.
Sapera threats not proved; witnesses partisan, contradicted.
All communal/false speech allegations in meetings (Gordha, Iglas etc.) not proved; PW unreliable (party switchers, no reports); RW credible.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Strict proof needed; High Court appreciation correct.

holdings.text: Election Commission validly postponed poll u/s.30 r/w s.21 General Clauses Act.
s.123(1)(A)(a) covers inducement to withdraw post-s.37 period.

statutes_cited.name: Representation of the People Act, 1951
statutes_cited.relevance: Governs election process, corrupt practices, Commission powers; court interprets poll postponement, bribery scope.

statutes_cited.name: General Clauses Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Power to notify includes amend/rescind; validates poll date change.

outcome.summary: Appeal against Allahabad High Court dismissal of election petition challenging Shiv Kumar Shastri's election dismissed. No corrupt practices proved; Election Commission postponement valid.

key_quotes.text: "Once this power is conferred under section 30 upon the Election Commission, the power to amend the same, which will include alteration of the dates of poll, can be exercised under section 21 of the General Clauses Act."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding on Commission's power to postpone poll.

key_quotes.text: "For the purpose of section 123 the words to withdraw or not to withdraw from being a candidate are of wide amplitude to include a subsequent withdrawal or not-withdrawal even at the last stage prior to the poll."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Interprets bribery provision broadly for election purity.

key_quotes.text: "Strict proof of the allegations is called for and the High Court has, in our opinion, rightly declined to accept the oral evidence of the appellants side."
key_quotes.speaker: court
